page.title: 09THE POLICE FORCE
page.content: The Headquarters for the North Wales Police Force is in Old Colwyn.The force has four divisions - A)Caernarfon,B)Llandudno,C)Prestatyn, D)Wrexham.There are one hundred and forty five officers of all ranks working at the Headquarters.They have a large operations room with computers and they handle all the paper work for North Wales.They have a fraud squad,a drugs squad, a traffic department and the C.I.D.Police cadets spend a week's initial training in the Headquarters before going on a thirteen week training course in Cwmbran. Colwyn Bay's own Police Station is in Rhiw Road.Thirty four officers work here,four of these are women.The most common crimes dealt with are burglary, theft from cars and vandalism.The opening of the Expressway makes the town more accessible to criminals.
